titlestmt.author: Megan Mummey

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The James Reid letters (dated 1790 February-May; 0.05 cubic feet; 2 items) consist of two letters from James Reid to his wife Mary Reid concerning his arrival in Kentucky and his attempts at homesteading.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: James Reid of New York homesteaded in Kentucky in 1790 and was married to Mary Reid.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2021ms031: [identification of item], James Reid letters, 1790 February-May, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The James Reid letters (dated 1790 February-May; 0.05 cubic feet; 2 items) consist of two letters from James Reid to his wife Mary Reid concerning his arrival in Kentucky and his attempts at homesteading. His letters describe his journey to Kentucky, his lost luggage, the construction of his house, and his current business partnership.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.
